item.title: 'I was crying all the time': Hollyoaks' Rachel Adedeji admits to 'struggling with baby blues' as she and husband introduce newborn daughter Lillian
item.description: Former X Factor star Rachel Adedeji candidly discussed her painful birth and 'baby blues' in a new family shoot with husband Jason Finegan.
item.content:encoded:
She welcomed her first child with husband Jason Finegan on 21st of December - a week before her expected delivery date. 

And former X Factor star Rachel Adedeji has now revealed the name of her newborn daughter, as well as candidly discussing her painful birth and the 'baby blues' that followed shortly after.

The TV queen, who now stars in Hollyoaks, stunned in a family shoot for OK! with her other half and new bundle of joy Lillian Oluremi Adedeji-Finegan, as she emotionally revealed she 'struggled' and 'cried' during the weeks following the birth.

Scroll down for video 

Beaming as she held on to her precious baby girl, Rachel stunned for the photoshoot in a multi-coloured, sequinned blouse while Jason cosied up to the two loves of his life. 

And while she looked in marital and parental bliss, the singer admitted that it has been a tough few weeks for her - stemming from the day she gave birth a week before her expected delivery date. 

Speaking to the publication, Rachel revealed she suffered from pre-eclampsia which meant her 'pain went from zero to a hundred in about a minute.'

'Because her heart rate kept dropping as my blood pressure kept increasing, they said they needed to get her out as soon as possible. Because of the diamorphine, I was so tired and I wasn’t pushing hard enough. So they had to give me an episiotomy and use a ventouse suction cup.’

No doubt, Jason was left in awe over his wife's strength as he confessed: ‘Rachel was a warrior. Seeing her in so much pain, I just wanted to take it all away from her.’

However, for Rachel the troubles didn't end there as she discussed her battle with 'baby blues.'  

'In terms of the aftermath, they say it’s the best thing ever, which it is, but then you start to worry about everything. No one told me about the baby blues,' she revealed. 

Detailing her struggles, Rachel continued: 'No one told me about how hard breastfeeding actually is. The struggle is so real and I think people try to paint it as perfect; I’d rather people just be honest about it.

'For me, it was just crying all the time at first, but it’s gone now. You’ve made this amazing human and you want the best for them, so you will cry and you might feel a bit sad but it’s okay, because it will eventually go. 

'I think if you don’t talk about it, that’s what could lead to postnatal depression,' Rachel advised. 

The pair are now proud parents to sweet one-month-old Lillian and Jason explained that his late Nan was called Lillian and they 'both really liked the name.'            

On Christmas day, Rachel delightedly took to Instagram with a sweet snap of her newborn where she revealed her bundle of joy was a week early. 

Rachel captioned the adorable image: 'Merry Christmas guys!! I was blessed to have received my Christmas present a whole week earlier than expected. We welcomed baby Adedeji-Finegan on the 21st of December at 5:38am weighing a healthy 8lbs14oz.' 

Rachel was due to be expecting her first child on December 27, however was given an amazing surprise of delivering a week early. 

Giving it a few days to settle into motherhood, the multi-talented star killed two birds with one stone as she wished her followers a Merry Christmas, while also revealing she had given birth a few days earlier. 

The image saw her younger lying on a bed covered in a chunky knitted grey blanket.     

While pregnant, Rachel turned to her co-star and new mum Jennifer Metcalfe for advice on motherhood, after successfully hiding her bump for six months.

Speaking to Closer magazine, she explained: 'Jen has been amazing - I couldn't ask for a better friend. As soon as I found out I was pregnant, I was like, 'Jen, what do I do?!'

'She's an amazing mum and seeing her and Greg with Daye is just adorable. We've been talking about holidaying together once my baby arrives.'

And clearly excited at the prospect of motherhood, Rachel said she feels 'ready' to be a mother. 

She told told The Mirror: 'I feel ready to be a mummy,' while Jason added: 'We are both really excited, nervous of course but we both feel ready. A Christmas baby!'

Rachel tied the knot with her partner Jason back in 2015 in Buckinghamshire and took to her Twitter page just before she walked down the aisle to thank people for their wishes.

She wrote at the time: 'Can't believe the day is finally here. In the next few hours I'll be a blushing bride. Thank you to everyone for your wishes. Xx (sic).'

The happy couple celebrated the big day with a honeymoon in Indonesia last December. 

In early December, Rachel took to social media to shame smokers who light up right outside the front door of a women's hospital.

Rachel vented her frustration at visitors who smoke right outside the entrance of Liverpool Women's Hospital which exclusively treats pregnant women and their babies - leaving her to walk through a curtain of smoke.

The TV queen, who now stars in Hollyoaks, stunned in a family shoot for OK! with her other half and new bundle of joy Lillian Oluremi Adedeji-Finegan, as she emotionally revealed she 'struggled' and 'cried' during the weeks following the birth.

item.title: Lingerie, hair extensions and revealing outfits mother forced her daughter, 15, and niece to wear so she could sell their bodies for sex are uncovered by police in Argentina
item.description: A woman in Buenos Aires has been arrested after allegedly advertising her 15-year-old daughter and niece as prostitutes on the internet. Police raided the house and found a baby born to one of the girls.
item.content:encoded:
A woman in Buenos Aires allegedly offered her 15-year-old daughter and niece as prostitutes on the internet.

The unnamed 42-year-old was arrested in the Pinamar area of the Argentine capital for reportedly advertising the girls on the internet for sexual services. 

Police photos show sex toys, fetish underwear, hair extensions, cash and several mobile phones allegedly used by the woman to run her sordid business.

Officers also made the shocking discovery of a baby born to one of the girls. 

The girls had gone to the woman's house on Christmas Eve believing they would spend the holidays there with their mother and aunt, local media reported. 

If hired by a customer, the pair were allegedly taken to a meeting point by a chaperone or made to receive clients in the woman's rented home.

They were also told to pretend they were over 18 when dealing with clients, it is claimed.

A few minutes of sex with either of the girls was said to be priced at £57 (1,500 Argentine Peso).

Police are said to have discovered how old the girls were after raiding the property, but the age of the niece has not been reported.

The girls and baby were put in the care of social services and the woman has been charged with the exploitation of minors.

She could face 10 years in prison. 

Prosecutor Walter Mecuri called the case 'promotion and facilitation of prostitution'.

It is said that many of the alleged clients were tourists, although there were also locals.
item.dc:abstract: A woman in Buenos Aires allegedly offered her 15-year-old daughter and niece as prostitutes on the internet. The unnamed 42-year-old was arrested in the Pinamar area of the Argentine capital for reportedly advertising the girls on the internet for sexual services. Police photos (pictured right) show sex toys, fetish underwear, hair extensions, cash and several mobile phones allegedly used by the woman to run her sordid business. Officers (pictured right) also made the shocking discovery of a baby born to one of the girls.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE - Civil war at Hollywood’s most elite sex club: Infamous $75K-a-year member 'Bunnyman' is booted out for his 'disgusting' behavior towards the founder's 12-year-old daughter
item.description: Phuong Tran, who is also known as the Bunnyman, was accused of ‘disgusting behavior’ by Hollywood sex club Snctm which took the extraordinary step of publicly naming him and releasing his picture.
item.content:encoded:
A wealthy member of an elite sex club has been kicked out for inappropriate behavior - and forfeited his $75,000 a year membership. 

Phuong Tran, who is also known as the Bunnyman, was accused of ‘disgusting behavior’ by Snctm which took the extraordinary step of publicly naming him and releasing his picture. 

Tran is said to have been ‘mean-spirited’ and ‘exploitative’ and sent messages on Instagram to the 12-year-old daughter of a Snctm founder which left her upset.

According to a profile in Esquire Tran is 34-year-old Vietnamese immigrant and was the very first person to buy a Snctm membership. 

He described himself as sexually repressed until he attended one of the events and is now so liberated that he wears a black leather mask and rabbit ears when he’s partying. 

Scroll down for video 

Snctm’s decision to publicly name Tran - an apparent breach of its own rules regarding secrecy - speaks to the extent of the rift between the two parties. 

Snctm parties in Beverly Hills, Los Angeles and New York for the ultra wealthy and the beautiful where they indulge their fantasies with lovers and strangers, often in view of others. 

The events have been called ‘Hollywood’s most elite sex party’ and attendees include actresses, billionaires and executives. 

In a release to its members, Snctm said that Tran was losing his Dominus membership, which costs $75,000 and is only available to 20 people worldwide. 

Nothing he says may be relied upon, and he is now outside our circle forever. We won’t tolerate mean-spirited or exploitative behavior towards others at Snctm, even from our highest ranking members
Snctm statement 

Basic memberships cost $20,000 each year and three individuals have the Violet Key Benefactors which are a one time payment of $1million. 

In a statement Snctm said: ‘Phuong Tran aka the Bunnyman has been banned for life from the club for behavior unbecoming of a Snctm member. 

‘He was stripped of his Dominus membership, and will never again be seen walking our hallowed halls. 

‘Nothing he says may be relied upon, and he is now outside our circle forever. We won’t tolerate mean-spirited or exploitative behavior towards others at Snctm, even from our highest ranking members. 

‘Yesterday Phuong stooped so low as to contact our founder’s 12 year old daughter on Instagram with messages that hurt her deeply. This was the final straw. 

‘We feel it necessary to shine light on his disgusting behavior, taking the extraordinary step to expose one of our former members so that our growing community knows to avoid him. 

‘We have never done this before. Phuong’s actions are despicable, and we are compelled to announce the truth’. 

Tran’s Dominus membership would have cost him $75,000 a year meaning that since Snctm was founded in 2012 he would have paid around $500,000 in total. 

It would have got him entry the private ‘Oculus Dei’ lounge at Masquerade events. 

Scntm says that ‘inside this elite sanctuary ‘awaits decadent indulgences many will never know’. 

Dominus members participate in an initiation ceremony discovering a secret password, gain access to private World Tour experiences with free-flowing Cristal champagne served by a butler.  

An Instagram page which has the handle snctm_bunnyman, appearing to belong to him is filled with pictures of women bound by ropes or scantily clad in just their underwear. 

Posts shared to the account in November paint a picture of a member disgruntled with the club. One was captioned: 'The Snctm Family is Dead, Long Live Sanctum Club. Feel free to share, tag a friend, be “extra,” or whatever you millennials like to do....'

Another post said: 'In the beginning, Sanctum Club was a magical place. In my original vision, it was to be a world of intrigue and sensuality. Gentlemen wore black tie while women were elegantly dressed. Everyone wore a mask. Together sightings and indulgences of an erotic nature would be experienced.

'The Club was to exist solely to serve the social and entertainment needs of its members and guests, by maintaining the highest standards of excellence while providing creative and culturally rich programs, and by providing a safe and comfortable environment for personal exploration.

'That is no longer the case. The pillars (privacy, safety, and exploration) that sustained the Club have crumbled'. 

In a post on a website linked to the Instagram account, the member again complains that the ‘pillars of privacy, safety and exploration’ which sustained Snctm have ‘crumbled’. 

He complained that it is more like a ‘college house party’ and there are no longer any ‘intimate moments’. 

It also says that allowing TV cameras in to film a show was an ‘appeal to the lowest common denominator’ and that it is no longer an ‘elite’ club.

A provocative documentary series aired on Showtime last year offering a candid look behind the scenes of the club.

The eight-part series titled Naked SNCTM, which premiered in mid-August, followed the exploits of the club's founder, Damon Lawner, as he and his team of burlesque performers, event planners and chefs host Eyes Wide Shut-style events mixing erotic theater, S&M and masquerade. 

Lawner, 45, who is a father-of-two and divorced, founded the club four years ago.

The Showtime series delved into Lawner's struggle to balance his unique career as the ringmaster of the high-end erotic three-ring circus with his 'normal life'. 

The founder of SNCTM previously claimed its members include Grammy-winning artists and said Gwyneth Paltrow has attended their parties with her Glee producer fiance, Brad Falchuk.

Lawner said he and his staff are banned from engaging in sexual activities during their events, but, according to an article published in the New York Post last year, he likes to watch. 

The club hosts monthly adult black-tie costume parties, private dinner soirees and summer pool parties where female guests can come dressed in a bikini, or opt for their birthday suit. 

The Esquire profile describes Tran as somebody who likes to ‘geek out’ on a subject until he becomes an expert.

His hobbies - aside from Japanese bondage techniques - include fine Scotch whiskey, cigars and tobacco pipes and Post WWII art. 

Tran said that he joined up ‘because some of my friends were in other private social clubs, like the Johnathan Club and the California Club, and I wanted to be able to reciprocate with something a little different’. 

Snctm was founded in 2012 by entrepreneur Damon Emanuel Lawner who has said in previous messages to members that it is ‘comprised of respectable individuals from all walks of life, dedicated to enriching our Grand Playground’. 

The divorced father-of-two in his late 40s has described Snctm as a ‘spiritual and erotic utopia’ where people can act out a real life version of the Stanley Kubrick film ‘Eyes Wide Shut’.

Tran is said to have been ‘mean-spirited’ and ‘exploitative’ and sent messages on Instagram to the 12-year-old daughter of a Snctm founder which left her upset. According to a profile in Esquire Tran is 34-year-old Vietnamese immigrant and was the very first person to buy a Snctm membership. He described himself as sexually repressed until he attended one of the events and is now so liberated that he wears a black leather mask and rabbit ears when he’s partying. The founder of SNCTM previously claimed its members include Grammy-winning artists and said Gwyneth Paltrow (seen inset) has attended their parties with her Glee producer fiance, Brad Falchuk.

item.title: Another Kollection? Pregnant Khloe Kardashian set to launch 'Koko make-up line'... shortly after sister Kourtney 'reveals plans' to follow in Kim's footsteps with her own cosmetics range
item.description: Pregnant Khloe Kardashian, 33, has filed paperwork to release a make-up line to keep with the family business, according to TMZ.
item.content:encoded:
Her sister Kourtney Kardashian is said to be following in the footsteps of her sisters Kim Kardashian and Kylie Jenner by 'preparing to launch her own cosmetic range.' 

And not one to be left in the dust, pregnant Khloe Kardashian has now reportedly filed paperwork of her own to release a make-up line to keep with the family business. 

According to TMZ, the Revenge Body star, 33, has applied to trademark the names 'KOKO Kollection by Khloe Kardashian' and 'KOKO Kollection.'

Scroll down for video 

Her application reportedly covers a vast range of make-up merchandise, but it is too soon to state particular products. 

MailOnline has contacted representatives for Khloe for further comment. 

This comes after her older sister Kourtney allegedly filed legal documents to own the business name 'Kourt' to launch her own cosmetics line.

Keeping her cards close to her chest, she filed the application under her company name '2Die4Kourt'. 

And while she hasn't hinted at any beauty range yet, the KUWTK star has recently been uploading more beauty content on her app, including her favourite natural cosmetics and her everyday make-up. 

She was also the ambassador for New Zealand based skincare brand Manuka Doctor and prides her youthful look on regular detox salt baths, moisturising with organic coconut oil and drinking apple cider vinegar. 

Khloe and Kourtney's family are no strangers to beauty world with youngest sister Kylie, 20, launching a successful cosmetic range in 2015.

The beauty mogul kicked-off her business, Kylie Cosmetics, with her liquid lipstick and lip liner duo, the Kylie Lip Kit, and has since added eyeshadow palettes, lipsticks, concealer, foundation and make-up brush to her ever growing empire.

Although an e-commerce business, she recently delved into a bricks and mortar model with her Kylie Truck - which travelled to various locations around Los Angeles selling her line.

Kylie has been very successful as according to Women's Wear Daily back in September 2017, she had earned $420 million in retail sales in 18 months.   

 It is also estimated that her brand will hit one billion dollars by 2022. In the exclusive story, WWD reported at the time that Kylie Cosmetics will see a 25% increase in sales in 2017 - which would be $386 million.

Kylie told the website: 'I do want stores, my own store...I think it's time people walk into a store and see Kylie Cosmetics.

In 2016, she released the limited edition Birthday Collection, which brought in $10 million in 24 hours.

Kylie's mom Kris Jenner presented documentation to WWD to prove the incredible sales numbers - the first time they have ever disclosed the information. 

For comparison, Lancome reached one billion dollars in 2015 after 80 years in the beauty world, according to WWD. Estee Lauder's Tom Ford Beauty took a decade to hit $500 million in sales, they added.

Kylie released her first three items on November 30, 2015; they were the Dolce K, Candy K and True Brown K Lip Kits.

The $29 kits - which have a lip liner and a coordinating lipstick - sold out in under 30 seconds on kyliecosmetics.com; WWD reported that they only had 5,000 kits in each color - so 15,000 units total.

Kylie and Kris have sine secured a partnership with Seed Beauty, a manufacturer based in Oxnard, California; they don't have any equity in her makeup company, WWD reported. 

The February 2016 launch saw the product numbers increase to six products with a total of 500,000 units, as well as the Kylie Lip Kits officially becoming Kylie Cosmetics.

And it's not only Kylie that reaping the benefits of the cosmetics world after Kim, 37, launched her KKW beauty range in 2016.

In December, the star - who has just welcomed her third child, Chicago, with husband Kanye West via surrogate, has revealed that her new shimmering highlighters and lip glosses - called the Ultralight Beams collection. 

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star's perfume collection, KKW Fragrances, sold out in just six days.

The initial launch brought in about $14 million for the savvy businesswoman; she sold the entire inventory of $300,000 perfumes, according to People.

Kim's first collection included three fragrances: Crystal Gardenia, Crystal Gardenia Citrus and Crystal Gardenia Oud. She sold $1 million worth of perfumes one hour after its launch, TMZ reported.

And not one to be left in the dust, pregnant Khloe Kardashian has now reportedly filed paperwork of her own to release a make-up line to keep with the family business. According to TMZ , the Revenge Body star, 33, has applied to trademark the names 'KOKO Kollection by Khloe Kardashian' and 'KOKO Kollection.'

item.title: 'He's a dear friend': Gemma Collins shuts down claims she is back with James 'Arg' Argent... after peeving Piers Morgan by arriving 30 minutes late to Good Morning Britain interview
item.description: emma Collins was quick to insist things aren't heating up between herself and long-time TOWIE love interest James 'Arg' Argent while appearing on Monday's installment of Good Morning Britain.
item.content:encoded:
They raised eyebrows when he was pictured making an early getaway from her house over the weekend. 

But Gemma Collins was quick to insist things aren't heating up between herself and long-time TOWIE love interest James 'Arg' Argent while appearing on Monday's installment of Good Morning Britain. 

The 36-year-old reality star - who appeared to peeve host Piers Morgan after arriving 30 minutes late - was typically candid as she discussed her love life - or lack of, where Arg is concerned. 

Scroll down for video  

Quizzed by Susanna Reid on whether she is currently seeing her on/off beau, Gemma retorted: 'No.' 

However, her answer might still arouse some suspicion given that Arg was pictured leaving her house on his moped on Friday morning. 

The reality star appeared to want to keep a low profile as he exited her home in a very casual ensemble of tracksuit bottoms, a waterproof jacket and trainers. 

However, Gemma claimed his visits are more innocent than they appear, claiming that he actually stops to see her neighbour, Ferne McCann, and merely pops in for a cup of tea when he's passing through. 

She added: 'The press keep saying he's popping by my house - he pops to see Ferne. Ferne is my neighbour, so he says, "Gem, I'm popping by for tea".' 

While Gemma's relationship with Arg remains one of TOWIE's leading storylines, Piers admitted he had never heard of the star, who the Celebrity Big Brother star described as a 'dear friend'. 

Gemma and Arg have enjoyed an on/off relationship since they first started dating in 2012.

Yet Arg delighted TOWIE viewers by finally confessing his feelings for Gemma in the show's Christmas special, though their friendship has struggled to blossom into anything more after he announced he is uprooting and moving to Spain.  

But Gemma seems to have taken the news in good spirits, and has recently thrown herself back into the dating game after signing up to star in Celebs Go Dating.  

She is among a slew of famous faces who will look for love on the E4 reality favourite, with Love Island's Mike Thalassitis and Made in Chelsea's Sam Thompson and Ollie Locke also set to star.

item.title: It's melting Monday! Landslide forces train to derail as Britain is hit by floods after weekend snow thaws amid soaring temperatures with 59F highs set for tomorrow - making UK hotter than Athens
item.description: A landslide caused an early-morning train in the Scottish Highlands to derail, but only five passengers were on board the 6.03pm service from Mallaig to Glasgow when it came off the track.
item.content:encoded:
Snow is thawing across Britain today, bringing the risk of flooding ahead of temperatures soaring to 15C (59F) tomorrow - making the UK hotter than Athens.

Following a bitingly cold weekend that saw Britain blasted by blizzard conditions and experiencing its coldest night in two years, parts of the UK will be warmer than the Greek capital tomorrow, which will only reach 12C (54F).

Up to a foot of snow fell in Scotland and on hilltops in northern England over the weekend, but it also covered fields as far south as the Cotswolds and Home Counties. It will now turn to slush as the mercury rises nationwide.

Meanwhile, more floods are expected in the South West of England where some residents were forced to flee their homes as heavy rain caused rivers to burst their banks. The Environment Agency has issued 56 flood alerts and nine more serious warnings, across areas including Cambridgeshire, Somerset, Northamptonshire and Devon.

In the Highlands, a landslide caused an early-morning train to derail, although only five passengers were believed to have been on board the 6.03am service from Mallaig to Glasgow Queen Street when it came off the track. 

The slip resulted in the line being blocked between Arisaig and Glenfinnan, Lochaber. No one was hurt in the incident. Rail operator ScotRail said services between Fort William and Mallaig will not run for the rest of the day.

A replacement bus service has been introduced which is providing back-up for trains between Fort William and Mallaig. A spokesman for Network Rail said: 'The train has been derailed but it has remained upright.'

In North Devon, dramatic photographs showed the damage caused by a landslide that left several properties flooded. Residents had to be evacuated over the weekend after heavy rainfall swamped towns and villages.

In some areas floodwater around 5ft deep washed through roads as homes and businesses struggled to keep it at bay. A major clear up operation is now underway with the village of Muddiford among the worst affected.

Darren Knill, who lives in Muddiford, said the water 'just kept rising' causing 'chaos' in the area. He said: 'I reckon it was up to about 1.5m (4.9ft). I haven't seen anything like it since I was a kid.'

The 16th century Muddiford Inn was in a precarious position as emergency services worked desperately trying to stem the flow of water, and a tractor attempted to stop it from reaching the pub's entrance.

Devon and Cornwall Police said the heavy rainfall had caused landslides, flooding and road damage. Officers said homes in Barnstaple had also been evacuated after the River Venn burst its banks.

Steve Isaacs, from Devon and Somerset Fire and Rescue, said it had 'created its own flow through people's gardens and into peoples houses'. 

Looking for some #MondayMotivation? It's all change on the temperature front to start this week, thanks to a mild southwesterly wind. Colder again to end the week, but not as cold as recent days! pic.twitter.com/Rgv1ttxXre

— Met Office (@metoffice) January 22, 2018

Whilst it won't be as strong as last week, the jet stream will be running across the UK this week bringing unsettled weather pic.twitter.com/e8sxkjEgU4

— Met Office (@metoffice) January 21, 2018

Hugh Griffiths, from Devon County Council, said: 'We've got a lot of roads affected in north Devon, with some properties which have been flooded. There's also landslips and debris washing over gullies.'

Several major roads were also deemed impassable. The A399 at Combe Martin was closed after a landslide caused a section of the road to collapse, while the North Devon Link Road was also swamped by rain.

Network Rail said trains are also unable to operate between Porth and Treherbert in South Wales due to a landslip.

A 'major operation' is now underway to clear up damage from the torrential rain. Conservative councillor Andrea Davis, who represents Combe Martin Rural, said that her area of North Devon was 'the worst affected'.

She tweeted: 'There is now a major operation underway by Devon County Council and our contractor Skanska. Please drive carefully as sweepers, JCBs etc will be in our roads working.'

In Somerset, Cheddar Gorge remains closed to traffic. Avon and Somerset Police said heavy rainfall had washed 'some rocks and debris into the gorge', leaving vehicles unable to travel through.

But forecasters are now predicting a milder and drier week, with temperatures rising to double figures - potentially as high as 14C (57F) in Bristol and London and 13C (55F) in Newcastle tomorrow.

Temperatures are expected to lower to between 8C and 10C by the end of the week. The Met Office has said it will be 'fairly unsettled' and 'changeable - but in between that there are some sunny spells'. 

The North East could see heavy showers, possibly with hail and thunder, on Wednesday. And there is potential for snow over higher ground in the north at the end of the week.

Yesterday the Queen had to take shelter under an umbrella as she braved freezing conditions when she attended church near Sandringham in Norfolk, and floods caused landslips in South West England.

Temperatures had plummeted overnight, with a low of -13.7C (7F) recorded in the Highland village of Altnaharra. There was just under an inch of snow in Little Rissington, Gloucestershire, and flakes of snow in North London.

In Norfolk, it started snowing while the Queen attended the morning service at St Lawrence Church in Castle Rising with Prince Philip, the Duke of York, Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie.

The 91-year-old, who was wearing a long green coat with a matching hat, sheltered under an umbrella as she left. The Queen amused onlookers by taking a wrong turning as she walked back to her Range Rover.

She had been dropped off at the main gate, but her car went to a side gate to pick up her and 96-year-old Philip. A church warden mistakenly guided her back towards the main gate, prompting an onlooker to shout: 'No'.

The Queen turned round when she realised the mistake and headed to the side gate. The snow caused awful conditions – with some major roads in the Pennines and Cumbria left impassable – before turning to rain. 

Glasgow Airport was temporarily closed and five people were hurt in a two-car crash on the A82 near Glen Coe. But where the weather was milder in South West England, an inch and a half of rain fell in 12 hours. 

Stranded walker rescued from snowdrift in Scotland after having no electricity for SEVEN DAYS  

A mountain rescue team has rescued a man who became stranded as he tried to walk to safety after a week cut off by snow.

The 64-old man, who lived in a remote location near Eskdalemuir in Dumfries and Galloway, had been cut off with no power for the last seven days.

He decided to try walking to the nearest village yesterday afternoon but found his way blocked by huge snowdrifts.

The 64-year-old called for help at around 4pm after trying to walk through deep snow for more than four hours.

Moffat Mountain Rescue Team (Moffat MRT) members arrived just after dark and tried to drive towards where they believed the man to be, but had to abandon their vehicle and proceed on foot.

After battling through drifts for two hours, two team members managed to reach the man.

Further team members followed on and started to trample a path through the snow to assist the man to the team Land Rover, which they reached at around 8.30pm.

He was then evacuated to the road where he was passed to police who took him to Lockerbie.

Twenty team members were involved in the rescue operation.

It comes days after Moffat MRT helped check on drivers who were stranded on the M74 for hours in heavy snow on Tuesday night into Wednesday.

Shaun Duignan, team leader said: 'This has been a busy week for the team with many team members working through the night to help stranded drivers and then a rescue closer to the expected role of a mountain rescue team, rescuing someone from a remote inaccessible location.

'The team is pleased to have been able to assist the people of Dumfries and Galloway.' 

Devon was particularly badly hit. Ten homes were flooded in the villages of Swimbridge and Landkey. Flooding and landslips blocked roads including the A399 at Combe Martin and A361 near Barnstaple. 

The Met Office said the polar air has now been replaced with a western airstream from the Caribbean, bringing much milder temperatures.

Meteorologist Alex Burkill said: 'Once a band of rain clears out of the way tomorrow, temperatures, could reach 15C (59F) in eastern Wales and parts of the West Midlands where the cloud breaks.'

A Met Office spokesman added: 'The morning rush hour is looking milder than of late and dry for many, but in the south west it'll be a wet start and there'll be some showers in the north.' 

They warned that 'some injuries from slips and falls on icy surfaces are possible' until late morning, especially in North East England and Yorkshire.

The Environment Agency issued flood warnings for people to take 'immediate action' on the rivers Taw and Exe in mid-Devon, and three others in Somerset and Wiltshire.

Further flood warnings were in place on the River Wye in Herefordshire and Riseley Brook in Bedfordshire. In Somerset, Cheddar Gorge was closed to traffic after rain washed 'rocks and debris' into it.

Train services between London, Devon and Bristol, and services in South Wales were affected by flood waters last night. Great Western Railway said flooding between Swindon and Chippenham meant all lines were blocked. 

Homes evacuated in Devon due to widespread flooding 

Homes have been evacuated and roads blocked in north Devon, with the A399 at Combe Martin closed following a landslide causing part of the carriageway to collapse.

The A361 is also closed near Landkey in Barnstaple and mudslides have been reported at Muddiford, north of Barnstaple, police said.

A Devon and Cornwall Police spokesman said: 'We are dealing with a number of reports of flooded roads and properties in north Devon.

'Emergency services, alongside Highways teams, are busy dealing with incidents as they arise but the public should be aware of continuing disruption today with ongoing bad weather in the area.

'Conditions are expected to worsen in early to mid-afternoon due to continuing heavy rainfall.

'We would urge any member of the public to avoid travelling into or around the area unless the journey is critical. If anyone has to travel they should take care while driving in the area due to large amounts of surface water and debris, and are urged to slow down.'  

Saturday night saw the coldest temperature recorded in the UK since February 14, 2016, when -14.1C (6.6F) was recorded at Braemar in Aberdeenshire.

Met Office forecaster Steven Keate said the near 15C difference was 'pretty unusual for the UK', adding: 'The broad theme is it is turning milder from the west, but before we get there some snow will fall.'

Yesterday five people were injured in a two-car crash on the A82 near to Glencoe Mountain Resort as drifting snow caused hazardous conditions in the Highlands. The snow gates at Glencoe were closed as the weather got worse.

North Wales Police also warned of poor conditions on the roads due to snow and ice, particularly on routes in Snowdonia. The M4 motorway was closed yesterday near Bridgend after an accident in difficult conditions.

It happened between junctions 35 and 36 but there were no reported injuries. A South Wales Police spokesman said: 'Motorists are urged to amend their speeds accordingly and avoid travelling if at all possible.'

On Saturday, people faced six-mile tailbacks as they flocked to the slopes at Glencoe. Police said that the resort as well as the Nevis Range ski centre near Fort William were both at full capacity on that day.  

Walker airlifted to hospital during mountain rescue

An injured walker was airlifted to hospital after falling close to the summit of Slieve Donard in the Mournes, the mountain rescue team has said.

The man, who was one of a group of four walkers, is believed to have suffered spinal and pelvic injuries when he fell on his way down from the summit of the mountain.

The Mourne Mountain Rescue Team said it received a call for help at around 5pm on Saturday. The team responded and located the casualty just off the summit of Slieve Donard.

He was treated for suspected spinal and pelvic injuries along with mild hypothermia. The other members of the party were also treated for mild hypothermia.

The team said that due to the location and potential severity of the man's injuries, helicopter assistance was requested. The man was airlifted to hospital while the remaining party members were assisted off the mountain.

The rescue operation, which involved 18 members of the Mourne Mountain Rescue Team, Belfast and Newcastle Coastguards, Rescue 199 and the PSNI, concluded at 10.45pm on Saturday.
item.dc:abstract: Following a bitingly cold weekend that saw Britain blasted by blizzard conditions and experiencing its coldest night in two years, parts of the UK will be warmer than the Greek capital tomorrow, which will only reach 12C (54F). Up to a foot of snow fell in Scotland and on hilltops in northern England over the weekend, but it also covered fields as far south as the Cotswolds and Home Counties. It will now turn to slush as the mercury rises nationwide. In the Highlands, a landslide caused an early-morning train to derail, although only five passengers were believed to have been on board the 6.03am service from Mallaig to Glasgow Queen Street when it came off the track (pictured). The slip resulted in the line being blocked between Arisaig and Glenfinnan, Lochaber. No one was hurt, but rail operator ScotRail said services between Fort William and Mallaig will not run for the rest of the day.

item.title: NFL conspiracy theorists claim footage of an official congratulating Tom Brady after comeback victory proves the Patriots are unfairly favored by refs (after New England were only called for ONE foul all game)
item.description: Within seconds of the game's ending referee Clete Blakeman walked over to Brady and looked to be giving him a few words of congratulations before patting him on the chest.
item.content:encoded:
NFL conspiracy theorists and Patriots haters are understandably concerned after a referee congratulated Tom Brady for the win against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday.

Within seconds of the game ending, referee Clete Blakeman walked over to Brady and looked to be giving him a few words of congratulations before patting him on the chest. 

And after the Patriots were called for only one penalty through the entire game, the scene painted a suspicious picture to onlookers. 

Scroll down for video 

First guy to congratulate Brady? Number 34. What a teammate! pic.twitter.com/azXq3qgN43

— OurState_CSU (@OurStateCSU) January 21, 2018

The move was immediately called out as being inappropriate in light of referees need to stay impartial during games, and not give any one team the advantage.  

'First guy to congratulate Brady? Number 34. What a teammate,' Twitter page OurState_CSU joked with a video of the moment. Blakeman wears number 34 on his referee jersey. 

The move was also enough to gain notice of a number of NFL players on social media, and spark complaints from Patriots critics. 

Some are worried the move shows that the Patriots might have an unfair advantage in the Super Bowl.  

This game had the fewest penalties called on one team in a playoff game since the 2011 AFC Championship, when the Patriots (again) were only called for one in a win over the Baltimore Ravens. 

By comparison - the Jaguars were penalized six times and lost 98 yards. 

Sunday's win was a surprise to most onlookers after the Patriots came back from what could have been a crushing defeat in the fourth quarter. 

The Patriots appeared to have run out of luck as they entered the final quarter down 20-10, but two touchdowns from Danny Amendola from Brady passes saw them edge the AFC Championship game 24-20. 

Brady's wife Gisele Bundchen could't contain her joy after the Patriots took the win, screaming with joy alongside her husband's mother, Galynn, who missed most of her son's last season because of her fight with breast cancer.

The Patriots have won their last three playoff games when they've been losing by more than 10 points, and as the fourth quarter went on it became more and more inevitable that they would eventually take back the lead. 

The Jaguars - who entered the game as eight-point underdogs - looked like they might cling on to victory, until Amendola scraped over the line in with less than three minutes left on the clock. 

The Patriots will play in Superbowl LII against the Philadelphia Eagles on February 4. The Eagles pounded the Vikings on Sunday night.
item.dc:abstract: NFL conspiracy theorists and Patriots haters are understandably concerned after a referee congratulated Tom Brady for the win against the Jacksonville Jaguars on Sunday. Within seconds of the game's ending referee Clete Blakeman walked over to Brady and looked to be giving him a few words of congratulations before patting him on the chest. And after the Patriots were called for only one penalty through the entire game, the scene painted a suspicious picture to onlookers.

item.title: Celebrity Big Brother: 'Making sure the boom booms are covered?': Ashley James, 30, flaunts her ample cleavage in skimpy bikini as her romance with Ginuwine, 47, heats up in the hot tub
item.description: The pair - who shared their first kiss under the covers last week - took advantage of the freezing temperatures to cuddle up in next to nothing in the Borehamwood bungalow's jacuzzi.
item.content:encoded:
He gave her steamy lower back massage on Sunday night's installment. 

And now Ashley James, 30, has upped the ante as she showcased her sensational figure while sharing a hot tub with her new squeeze Ginuwine, 47, on Monday's Celebrity Big Brother.

The pair - who shared their first kiss under the covers last week - took advantage of the freezing temperatures to cuddle up in next to nothing in the Borehamwood bungalow's jacuzzi.

Scroll down for video  

Ashley showcased her hourglass figure in a skimpy monochrome bikini with pink floral print which managed to keep her ample cleavage intact.

At first leaving the house in her bathrobe, the reality star chanced entering the back garden barefoot but instantly regretted it as she attempted to quickly enter the hot tub.

The former Made in Chelsea starlet made sure to command attention as she held onto her bust, hopping into the water with aplomb.

American hitmaker Ginuwine asked: 'Making sure the boom booms are covered?'

But a distracted Ashley could only focus on the temperatures, she answered: 'Oh my God my feet are so cold'.

Relaxing in the hot tub, she covered her platinum blonde French plaits with a soft pink beanie as she engaged in conversation with the Pony singer about her love of sun cream.

She commented: 'I have been a factor 50 person for a long time because I want to be a very attractive grandmother'.

Later, the pair - who have confirmed they're 'seeing' each other in the Channel 5 compound - summoned pal Wayne Sleep, 69, to the hot tub for a chat.

Ashley playfully exclaimed: 'Darling I'm cheating on you in the hot tub. I am your hot tub honey forever.'

The exchange caused the professional dancer to start joking with the duo.

He began: 'Can I just ask you one question Ginuwine? Ha ha ha! Ginuwine not, you weren't Ginuwine to Waynie were you?

'Shall I just ask you one question, Ginuwine, would you like to live? Well then behave yourself'. 

The hot tub antics comes after the two amped up the PDA after he gave her a steamy lower back massage during Sunday night's episode of Celebrity Big Brother.

The father-of-nine - who is also a grandfather - admitted he was 'feeling turned on' when Ashley jokily told him to go 'lower and lower' during the back rub. 

Ashley and Jess Impiazzi stripped off to their bras in the bedroom as Malika Haqq and Ginuwine gave them massages.

As Ginuwine worked his way down Ashley's back, the Made In Chelsea star joked: 'Lower, lower... no, I'm joking!' to which he replied: 'I'm going to grab your booty.'  

He then turned to Malika and said: 'I don't know about you, but I'm getting kind of turned on!' 

'Yeah it's just you G, you're on your own buddy!' laughed Malika. 'You haven't touched a woman in a while.'  

Just hours later, Ashley admitted to Shane Jenek that she hadn't wanted to be a love interest, revealing: 'The only thing I said was that I don't want to have a house romance.'

The steamy display left viewers at home unimpressed, with several dubbing Nineties rapper Ginuwine 'creepy' and claiming their romance made them 'feel sick'.

Later on in the episode, Ginuwine - who fathered nine children by five different women - opened up about how kids should be raised.

He said that when girls 'don't have a daddy around' they 'be freaks a lot of the time' when they grow up.

He added: 'As fathers for some reason we dont worry as much about the fellas as we do about the girls. And rightfully so.'

The self-confessed womaniser added: 'I got so many girls because of my bulls**t back in the day.'
item.dc:abstract: He gave her steamy lower back massage on Sunday night's installment. And now Ashley James, 30, has upped the ante as she showcased her sensational figure while sharing a hot tub with her new squeeze Ginuwine, 47, on Monday's Celebrity Big Brother.

item.title: Laura Dern film depicting child sexual abuse - including underage rape scene - causes a stir at Sundance with reports of both a standing ovation and walkouts
item.description: Laura Dern and Isabelle Nélisse star in The Tale (main), which debuted at Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah this past weekend as Jennifer Fox. They portray adult and child versions of character.
item.content:encoded:
The latest film from Big Little Lies star Laura Dern has caused a stir at its Sundance debut, receiving both a standing ovation and audience walkouts.

The Tale, written and directed by documentary filmmaker Jennifer Fox, has been called a sort of 'memoir-as-film' and is a fictionalized account of an adult Fox reckoning with how she was taken advantage of by her two athletic trainers when she was 13 years old.

Dern, 50, stars as the adult Fox, who goes on a journey of reckoning after her mother, played by Ellen Burstyn, finds a story, the titular 'Tale', she wrote about the relationship.

'It's hard to believe that at 13, I handed in to my sixth grade teacher a "fictional" story about the sexual relationship I had with two adored sports coaches,' Fox told the Hollywood Reporter back when the film was announced in May 2016.

'Now, more than 40 years later, that story has become the basis of a true investigative thriller into one woman's memory, which could only be brought to the screen by the courageous acting powerhouse Laura Dern.'

The film opens with the line: 'The story you are about to see is true… as far as I know,' reports Indiewire, which saw the film at its debut on Saturday.

What follows is the journey Dern, as Fox, undertakes as she realizes that her equestrian trainer, called Mrs G in the film and played by Elizabeth Debicki, and her running coach, called Bill in the film and played by Jason Ritter, sexually assaulted her. The two are lovers in the film and their names have been changed from their real-life counterparts. 

The film alternates between adult Fox and child Fox, who is played by 14-year-old Isabelle Nélisse.

Most graphically, the film depicts Ritter's character raping the young Fox. The film's end credits note that an adult body double was used for Nélisse in the scene. The child actress did provide audio.

Bill seduces the young Fox with lines such as 'You're not afraid of life, right, Jenny?', 'We have to keep stretching you open, slowly' and 'No young boy would do this for you'.

During a Q&A after the film, writer-director and real-life inspiration Fox said she coached Nélisse through verbally acting out the rape scene with scenarios such as 'act like you’ve been stung by a bee' and 'act like you’re being chased by a dog'.

The Daily Beast reports that 'multiple people' walked out at the rape scene, which the outlet said is depicted in 'purposeful unflinching detail'.

The outlet notes: 'The Tale isn't a linear narrative about a child who was raped. It's an adult woman's journey to the horrifying realization that her innocence was preyed on....her struggle through frustrating notes of denial, rationalization, misremembrance and anger as she tries to piece together what really happened to her'.

The Huffington Post notes that at one point, Fox says in reference to her abuser: 'I find that I trust him so much I never understand where he’s leading me. Once we’re that far, I never know how to say no.'

Multiple critics and journalists who saw the film noted how timely it is in the context of the #MeToo movement sprung from the revelation of disgraced film producer Harvey Weinstein's pattern of sexually assaulting and harassing women.

Since then, multiple men in the film industry and elsewhere have been accused of misconduct as the nation has faced a reckoning about how men treat women - and girls.

Currently in the headlines, for example is the story of Larry Nassar, the former doctor for the USA Gymnastics team who has been sentenced to 60 years in prison on charges of child pornography.

More than 140 female athletes have come forward to say that he sexually assaulted them in his capacity as a doctor. 

The film received a standing ovation from its audience and received a perfect five stars from The Guardian and an A from Indiewire. The Huffington Post deemed the film '2018's first great movie'.

'The whole idea was to take out of the closet the idea that perpetrators aren't monsters that we can pick out,' director Fox said at the Q&A after the film. 

Academy Award-winning actress Ellen Burstyn said at the Q&A: 'The exploitation of innocence is a deep, criminal crime, and it’s time now, right now, in this moment in our history, to change it. 

'I want to thank Donald Trump for that disgusting tape that he made that we all heard that was the final straw that broke the camel’s back.

'And we can now at last deal with this problem that has gone on for centuries all over the world. This film is giving voice to it.' 

Her comments, per the Daily Beast, received a massive round of applause. 

Regarding the filming of the rape scene, Ritter said: 'No one wanted to create more trauma on the set, and having the body double there for me personally helped me to lean into it more.'

Through tears, he added: 'It was really complicated, and when it was a grown woman there, it was easier for me to try to do some of those scenes.'

This year's Sundance Film Festival lasts from January 18 to 28. It has been held in Park City, Utah since 1981 and is one of the largest independent film festivals in the world.

A Respect Rally - one of many women's marches held across the country - was held in the ski resort town on Saturday. Attendees included Jane Fonda and Gloria Allred.
item.dc:abstract: Laura Dern and Isabelle Nélisse star in The Tale (main), which debuted at Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah this past weekend as Jennifer Fox. They respectively portray adult and teenage versions of the character, who is in fact the film's real-life writer-director Jennifer Fox (bottom right). The film has been described as a sort of 'memoir-as-film' and details how Fox, as an adult, reckons with how she was sexually assaulted by her athletic trainers when she was 13 years old.
item.dc:creator: Forrest Hanson
item.mi:shortTitle: Laura Dern film depicting child sexual abuse causes stir at Sundance

item.title: Police force's tongue-in-cheek 'trick' to avoid speeding fines by staying below the limit goes viral
item.description: Waikato Police in New Zealand have shared their advice on Facebook and have since gone viral with more than 2300 reactions and 500 shares. It's part of a campaign to reduce speeding.
item.content:encoded:
New Zealand police have been lauded for a tongue-in-cheek advert sharing what it calls a trick to avoid speeding fines - driving within the limit. 

Waikato Police posted their advice onFacebook in a post that's since gone viral.

'This simple trick prevents the police from ever giving you a speeding ticket again,' their post last week said.

'We figured we'd post it here to try to help you all out.

'There's an online site that has come up with a trick that means you never have to worry about getting caught speeding again!

'It is absolutely brilliant. Best of all, the method works internationally, in every country in the world.

'Every year hundreds get caught for driving too fast... But did you know there's a way to avoid the hefty fines that come along with speeding?'

Here is how they said you can cleverly avoid speeding fines:

'1. Look closely at the signs on the road that show you the speed limit. The number indicated is the maximum speed you can travel. Whether you're on foot, bike or car,' they wrote.

'2. Try to locate your car's speedometer. You normally find it somewhere in front of the driver's seat, on the dashboard. It has an arrow pointing to the number that reflects the car's speed. On newer cars, the speed is sometimes displayed digitally, with numbers.

'3. This last point is also the hardest. Adjust your speed according to the number shown on the road sign. The police can not fine you if you do not drive over this number.'

'Strangely, there seem to be surprisingly too few who are aware of this simple yet genius trick,' they ended the post with. 

'And best of all, if you stick to it, you'll never have to pay a speeding fine ever again.

'Even better — the road will become much safer for everyone!'

People quickly reacted to the post, with one saying it is great advice.

'While doing so also give them a brush up on what are these funny yellow lines for, why can't I park in that handicapped park and so on,' they said.

Most people loved the sarcasm of the post.

'Thanks for sharing.....it is a little trick I use daily. My 35+ years driving using this trick has never failed me,' said another Facebook user.

New Zealand Police have also released a video urging Kiwis to slow down. 

'The latest TV ad is absolutely spot on ... too many drivers lack the respect for rules and only care about themselves ... how many drivers these days would even pass a theoretical test on road rules?' wrote another person. 

The new road safety advertising campaign is directly challenging speeding drivers to slow down and stop defending their perceived 'right' to speed.

Every week, 11 people are seriously injured or killed in a speed-related crash on New Zealand roads.

'But a substantial portion of our society does not see the connection between speed and crashes,' NZ Transport Agency Director of Safety and Environment Harry Wilson said.

'That needs to change, because the facts and the physics are indisputable.

'Speed is always a crucial factor in determining the severity of the crash and the severity of the injuries to the people involved. The simple and inescapable truth is that less speed means less harm in a crash.'
item.dc:abstract: Waikato Police in New Zealand have shared their advice on Facebook and have since gone viral with more than 2300 reactions and 500 shares. They have given three sarcastic tips people can follow. It is during a nationwide campaign by New Zealand Police urging Kiwis to slow down (pictured). Every week, 11 people are seriously injured or killed in a speed-related crash on New Zealand roads.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bedo
item.mi:shortTitle: Police reveal 'genius trick' to avoiding hefty speeding fines

item.title: 'But I want to marry mommy!' Four-year-old boy's adorable - but unimpressed - reaction when his mother shows him her engagement ring and explains what it means
item.description: This little boy from Illinois had an adorable reaction to being told his mother was engaged to her boyfriend - he was confused why she wasn't marrying him.
item.content:encoded:
This little boy had an adorable reaction to being told his mother was engaged to her boyfriend - he was confused why she wasn't marrying him.

Asher, four, declared that he wanted to 'marry his mommy' when she shared the news of her engagement to her partner of five months Ian Faulker. 

His mother Jasmine Brennan, from Frankfort in Illinois, couldn't wait to tell Asher the good news and she was sure he would be delighted as he loves Ian.

However the he was slightly underwhelmed by the announcement and he met it with stern - but endearing - objections. 

When Jasmine asks her son what he thinks engagement is he says that it means keeping the ring on 'all night'. 

Although when Jasmine explains that it actually means that Ian wants to marry her Asher proclaims that he does too.

He then sweetly scolds Ian with a 'no' at this plea to let him walk his mother down the aisle.

The adamant young boy goes on to say 'I'm going to marry my mommy, you will not' as his mother chuckles at her sons explosion of emotion.

However the hilarious outburst seems like a regular occurrence for Asher.   

Jasmine said: 'Asher is a charismatic, charming mommy's boy - he's the class clown but also wears his heart on his sleeve.

'After Ian proposed, we had about ten minutes before Asher came crashing in asking questions.

'My bonus [step] mum started recording, because - knowing Asher - she was sure he'd have something hilarious come out of his mouth.

'Asher's obsession with marriage came when his father got married in November and it's sparked his interest since then.

'Asher has always been a mommy's boy, I expected a reaction like this out of him, he becomes very territorial over me.

'He's my best friend and he knows it.

'Asher is still convinced that I'll change my mind and marry him anyway.

'Despite his reaction, Asher loves Ian and the first time he told him so, it was a very sweet moment.

'Ian has helped the kids bake bread, spell their names and has stepped in and helped in the everyday role that Asher lacked in a male figure and Asher loves him for it.

'I've always thought he was the funniest kid around and it's incredible to see others witness what a little joy he is too.'
item.dc:abstract: This little boy had an adorable reaction to being told his mother was engaged to her boyfriend - he was confused why she wasn't marrying him. Asher, four, declared that he wanted to 'marry his mommy' when she shared the news of her engagement to her partner of five months Ian Faulker. His mother Jasmine Brennan, from Frankfort Illinois, couldn't wait to tell Asher the good news and she was sure he would be delighted as he loves Ian.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Dean
item.mi:shortTitle: 'But I want to marry mommy!' Boy has cute reaction to engagement news
